page.title: 19BARROW CHURCHES
page.content: In 1820 there were two Methodist Churches one on North Street the other on High Street. In 1970 the congregations began to use the church on North Street. In 1822 the first Baptist Church was built, later in 1875 it was replaced by the present church. In the church grounds stood eleven graves. The parish Church, Holy Trinity was built in the 1100's. The tower was built again in 1869, after it fell down while it was being underpinned. The noise was heard all over Barrow. In the 1800's to signal fires in the village the bells were rung backwards. The small Catholic Church, St. Albans, was built at the same time as the railway in 1839. The jitty running beside the church is called Hollybush Lane. The Church of Christ meets at Bishop Beveridge on South Street.{L.MORLEY,J.SCATTERGOOD
